page.title: 04The Local Shop
page.content: sells{convenience foods}such as tinned beans, tinned soups,fish-fingers etc. They also sell{frozen foods}like chips and peas, which are in a big freezer by the window. The man who owns and runs the shop wanted to work there because he was tired of working for a large firm.{The people of Kirkby buy {more food to prepare than they buy {convenience foods.}Sometimes people ask the shopkeeper for things he does not stock, like some vegetables, such as cauliflowers, because they go bad too easily. The shop sells farm produce; from local farmers he gets potatoes. The shopkeeper himself buys his food partly from his own shop and partly from Barrow and Ulverston.{The {shop is very popular because it is the {only shop in Kirkby.
